excuse me why the September 15 2014
email correspondence from Ron Ragland to

as an ex parte communication on
September 18 2014 if the Mississippi
Public Utilities staff was only serving
as a non-party advisor to the Commission
in docket 2014 UA 91. the opinion
presented for your vote today explains
that at the time the correspondence in
the question was sent to Mr McCool who
was the director of the public excuse me
of the water sewer division of the
public utilities staff at the time uh
two other parties had intervened in the
docket which rendered it contested as a
matter of law under Mississippi code
annotated section 77-13 yet neither of
those parties had been copied on the
correspondence at issue which rendered
it a prohibited ex parte communication
under the public utility act as a public
utility staff employee who was assisting
the Commission in its investigation and
Analysis of docket 2014 UA 91 Mr McCool
and the commission were bound to follow
the safeguards set forth in section
77-13 subsection 4
which required the former chairman to
place a copy of the communication into
the record and provide all parties with
notice and the opportunity to respond
which is what occurred
